title: Experience of a small country (Montenegro) in the COVID-19 epidemic and its impact on rehabilitation.
text: Experience of a small country (Montenegro) in the COVID-19 epidemic and its impact on rehabilitation.

similar.title: The Covid-19 pandemic in Denmark: Big lessons from a small country.
text: The Covid-19 pandemic in Denmark: Big lessons from a small country.

Denmark, a Scandinavian country of 5.8 million people has weathered the Covid-19 crisis with a relatively low rate of infection and death. Denmark has also become one of the first European countries to partially re-open its society. We offer the perspective that the combination of rapid response from the government, trust and a high level of confidence in government by Danish citizens, and the importance of social heritage contributed to the effective management of the coronavirus crisis.
abstract: Denmark, a Scandinavian country of 5.8 million people has weathered the Covid-19 crisis with a relatively low rate of infection and death.
